data.title: Booking A Taxi To Sydney Bondi Beach with 13cabs
data.meta_description: 13 Cabs has the largest taxi fleet in Australia with fast Taxi access to and from Sydney Bondi Beach. Book your Taxi today!
data.text:
Can I share a ride to Bondi?

Sharing a ride in a 13cabs taxi in Sydney is easy. Enter multiple stops or pickups when you book, or let your Driver know when they arrive. Register your preferred payment to make ride sharing even easier.

Can you order a car seat for your child?

Yes, we’re happy to make it happen. Just let us know when you book. You can even bring your own. All taxis are fitted with anchor points to properly fit a car seat for your child.

How much is a taxi to Bondi?

When you book with the 13cabs app, you’ll get a Fixed Price. And when you book online you’ll get a fare estimate. That means you’ll know the price of your taxi fare before you ride. Simply choose your:

Pickup address

Destination

Service

And the price will appear.

How much is a taxi from the city to Bondi?

Taking a cab from the Sydney CBD to Bondi Beach means hassle-free door-to-door travel. We’ll carry all your gear in the boot, and you won’t have to worry about missing your stop. A 13cabs taxi fare will cost approx $40, depending on traffic at the time.

Can you pre book cabs to Bondi?

13cabs makes it easy to book a taxi, 24/7. You can book now or up to 7 days in advance a few ways:

13cabs app. Fast, one-tap bookings, with a range of innovative features.

Online. Book via our website for a fare estimate and manage multiple trips at once.

Phone number. Call us on 13 2227.

How far is Bondi from Sydney airport?

Taking a 13cabs airport transfer is the perfect way to go directly from the airport at Mascot to Bondi and Bondi Beach. You won’t have to wait for, or squeeze onto public transport. And booking early means not having to wait in taxi queues. Bondi Beach is about half an hour’s drive from the airport. And 13cabs can drop you off a couple of metres from the sand.

What is the cheapest way to get from the Bondi to the city?

When you choose a 13cabs Sydney taxi to get from Bondi to the Sydney CBD, you’ll pay the same fare no matter what time of the day or night you travel. And there’s no surcharges for busy times or during big events. And you also won’t pay any late or cancellation fees when you ride with us.

How much does a MAXI cab cost from the airport to Bondi?

A MAXI TAXI is a minibus and can hold up to 10 passengers. They’re perfect for a trip to the beach with family and friends. From the airport, the taxi fare will be about $50, depending on the traffic. But that fare stays the same no matter how many people travel. So, the more of you there are, the cheaper it is for each person.

What is the taxi fare estimate?

A fare estimate is an online tool which gives you an indication of what the fare is likely to be before you book. You’ll see it when you book online.

What range of taxi services are available in NSW?

13cabs has Australia’s biggest taxi fleet. That means more cab services, more often. When you’re in Sydney, you can choose from:

Family-sized sedan. Perfect for a trip to the beach with plenty of room for bags and towels.

SUV. For those who want a bit more room.

MAXI TAXI. A mini bus with room for 10 passengers.

Wheelchair Accessible Taxi. Make your trip to the beach hassle-free.

Silver Service. Travel to the beach in style with a luxury car and premium service.

Parcel Delivery. Our Drivers will deliver any parcel at any time, if it fits in their cab.

What are the highlights of Bondi Beach?

There’s nothing more Aussie than Bondi Beach. The legendary beach, surf, cafes, and characters are must-sees for everyone at least ones in their lives. And 13cabs can get you there.

Highlights of Bondi Junction

Bondi Junction is one of the big shopping hubs of the eastern suburbs. And it’s also home to the magnificent Waverley Oval. Grab a 13cabs taxi and you can take all your shopping home with ease.

Places to visit in Sydney and surrounds

Bondi Beach isn’t the only stunning attraction in Sydney. There’s a lot of them. A few beaches down is Coogee Beach which, according to some, is just as good as Bondi. And if it’s iconic Australian sites you’re after, you can’t go past Sydney Harbour, with Circular Quay, the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House.
